title: Erigon crashes/dies without error during snapshot indexing on Polygon
body:
Erigon version: 2.28.0-dev
OS: Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS

I am trying to sync a Polygon non-archive node with Erigon. After ~60 hours I got past the downloading snapshot phase. But when the snapshot indexing phase begins, Erigon appears to silently crash after about 1 to 2 minutes.

There are no error messages or warnings in the terminal when it happens, suddenly the Erigon process just disappears. I have tried restarting Erigon three times but each time the Erigon process dies somewhere in between the 1 to 2 minute mark after starting the snapshot indexing.

Here is how I start Erigon:
````
erigon \
--chain=bor-mainnet \
--prune=htrc \
--bor.heimdall=https://heimdall.api.matic.network \
--datadir="/media/pett3r/M.2 External/polygon_bor_data" \
--torrent.download.rate="512mb" \
--ws \
--port=30304 \
--http.port=8546 \
--authrpc.port=8553 \
--torrent.port=42068 \
--private.api.addr=127.0.0.1:9091
````
Here is an example of what the terminal output looks like when Erigon dies:

- CPU's amount? RAM amount?
- as a hotfix try reduce GOMAXPROC

fixed by https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/pull/5773

FYI: you can increase downloading speed by --torrent.download.rate

> fixed by #5773
> 
> FYI: you can increase downloading speed by --torrent.download.rate

Thanks. I have now upgraded Erigon to version 2.28.1-dev and tried again.

The patch helped, it doesnâ€™t crash after 2 minutes anymore. But Erigon still silently crashes after about 25-30 minutes into the snapshot indexing. I have tried it twice with the new Erigon version. First time it crashed after 28 minutes, second time after 26 minutes.

The PC I'm using has 32 GB RAM and has an Intel Core 19-11900H CPU. During the snapshot indexing the CPU load is high, between 80-97 %. RAM usage is around 15-17 GB.

One observation I made on the last crash is that Erigon reports a fairly constant sys RAM usage for a long time during the indexing phase, then, just before it crashes, the sys RAM starts increasing.
